meanings.definition: To increase in size or volume
meanings.sent1: The balloon began to swell as more air was blown into it.
meanings.sent2: The river tends to swell after heavy rainfall.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter started to swell over the edges of the pan.
meanings.sent4: Her heart swelled with pride as she watched her child perform on stage.
meanings.sent5: The crowd's cheers seemed to swell louder with each passing moment.

meanings.definition: A gentle movement of the sea
meanings.sent1: The sailors enjoyed the calm swell of the ocean beneath them.
meanings.sent2: The rhythmic swell of the waves was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent3: The gentle swell of the sea rocked the boat gently back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The swell of the tide carried the small boat out to sea.
meanings.sent5: The swell of the ocean seemed to dance under the moonlight.

meanings.sent1: She received a swell gift for her birthday.
meanings.sent2: The team did a swell job on their project presentation.
meanings.sent3: He always wears swell outfits to parties.
meanings.sent4: The movie received swell reviews from critics.
meanings.sent5: The weather was so swell that they decided to have a picnic in the park.
